citations.narrative:
The facility has not developed an emergency/disaster plan that addresses how to provide humane treatment, housing,
handling, transportation and husbandry of animals in the event of a disaster or emergency that could reasonably be
anticipated to happen in the area in which the facility is located. This emergency plan is an essential part of ensuring the
humane care and treatment of animals at the facility and must be developed, documented and followed. This plan must
be available for review by APHIS officials. Develop an emergency/disaster plan for all animals housed at the facility.
Correct by: 2/15/2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.134(a) 
   
Contingency planning. 
The facility has not developed an emergency/disaster plan that addresses how to provide humane treatment, housing, 
handling, transportation and husbandry of animals in the event of a disaster or emergency that could reasonably be 
anticipated to happen in the area in which the facility is located. This emergency plan is an essential part of ensuring the 
humane care and treatment of animals at the facility and must be developed, documented and followed. This plan must 
be available for review by APHIS officials. Develop an emergency/disaster plan for all animals housed at the facility. 
Correct by: 2/15/2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative. 
 
 n

species.common: RED FOX (INCLUDES SILVER FOX & CROSS FOX)
